product.name: Lemon Balm (Organic)
product.description:
Bulk Herbs: Lemon Balm (Organic)
Melissa officinalis

Format: C/S
Size: 1 oz package

Also known as: Melissa officinalis, melissa, balm

Farming Type: Organic
Origin: Bulgaria

Lemon balm is a flowering perennial native to southern Europe and the Mediterranean. It has since been cultivated in other parts of the world, and has become naturalized in North America. It is a member of the mint family, possessing a pleasant aroma, strikingly similar to that of lemon. The herb can grow to nearly five feet tall, producing small white flowers. The Latin name “Melissa” translates to “bee,” referring to the plant’s ability to attract honeybees and other insects.

The German Commission E has approved lemon balm for supporting a calm and healthy sleep. It has also been approved in supporting the gastrointestinal tract. Lemon balm has been shown in clinical trials to support healthy memory and cognitive function, as well as to increase self-reported calmness.

In magick, Lemon Balm is ruled by Moon and Water and is therefore a wonderful herb for healing and calm. A great herb to use for reducing stress and for healing emotional traumas.

Keywords: Healing, peace, success

product.description:
Biokoma Lemon balm (Melissa officinalis), balm, common balm, or balm mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant in the mint family Lamiaceae and native to south-central Europe, the Mediterranean Basin, Iran, and Central Asia, but now naturalized in the Americas and elsewhere. It grows to a maximum height of 70–150 cm (28–59 in). The leaves have a mild lemon scent similar to mint. The leaves are used as a herb, in teas, and also as a flavouring. It is grown as an ornamental plant and for its oil (to use in perfumery). The tea of lemon balm, the essential oil, and the extract are used in traditional and alternative medicine, including aromatherapy.

✓ Ease Restlessness & Fall Asleep Fast

✓ Improve Sleep Quality & Duration
✓ Wake Rested, Energized, & Refreshed

Melatonin
Often referred to as the “sleep hormone,” melatonin relaxes the mind and body, preparing it for deep REM sleep.

GABA
An inhibitory neurotransmitter that regulates brain wave activity and reduces the excitability of neurons.

L-Theanine
An amino acid from the tea leaves of Camellia sinensis plants that promotes recuperative natural sleep and relaxation.

L-Tryptophan
An essential amino that helps the body synthesize serotonin, a critical sleep inducing and mood balancing neurotransmitter.

Valerian Root
A perennial flowering plant that traditionally served as a sedative and anxiolytic agent in herbal teas.

Chamomile
A daisy-like flowering herb that contains apigenin, a compound responsible for mild sedation and anxiety reduction.

Hops Extract
An extract derived from the seed cones of Humulus lupulus plants known for its gentle and soothing anti-anxiety benefits.

Passion Flower
A perennial floral climbing vine found in neotropical regions known for its calming properties.

Lemon Balm
Used in herbal tea for centuries and touted for its ability to lessen the adverse effects of stress and anxiety.

Magnesium

Magnesium is an essential mineral involved in many important processes in the body that can aid sleep by helping you feel more calm and relaxed.

Amino Acids
Contains L-Cysteine, L-Tyrosine, and L-Glutamine, which promote cell rejuvenation benefiting healthy hair, skin, and nail growth.*

product.name: 4 Mint Collection Seed - Peppermint, Spearmint, Lemon Balm and Catnip Seeds -Non-GMO Heirloom Herbs
product.description:
• Mint Seed Mix - An assortment of packets with four popular mint varieties: Peppermint, Spearmint, Lemon Balm, and Catnip. Each one can be grown in containers and indoors if provided enough light. They also can be grown outdoors, planted directly in the soil or in a planter under natural light.

  • Herb Garden Essentials - These easy to grow herbs are edible and also medicinal, making them amazing choices for survival gardening, homesteading, or simply growing for fun. Mints attract beneficial pollinators to the garden, which benefits the rest of your plants. Cats will appreciate the catnip, as well.

  • Grow Now or Later - Plant now or store for future growing seasons. Will remain viable for years if stored in a cool dry location. Each packet has instructions for saving seeds so you can perpetuate your harvest and share with others.

  • Easy to Grow - Seeds come in a beautiful paper pack with instructions for successful growing and germination alongside your vegetables. Getting started is simple for both beginner and experienced gardeners.

  • Quality Seeds - Safe, non-hybrid non-GMO heirloom seeds proudly sourced in the USA for your family to plant and grow for years to come. Open-pollinated, naturally grown and selected to ensure the best germination rates.

Four varieties of mint seed for planting and growing in your home garden: Peppermint, Spearmint, Lemon Balm, and Catnip.

Peppermint is a must-have herb seed for planting in your garden, indoors or outside. Peppermint can thrive really well in a container garden, because the pot can keep it from spreading and taking over your garden. Add the fresh flavor to your favorite dishes, desserts, and drinks for a cool refreshing change of pace.

Spearmint is one of the most popular plants in the mint family. It is grown for numerous culinary, cosmetic, and medicinal uses.

Lemon Balm is a delicious fragrant herb that will perform well in your garden. Just give it a sunny spot and lots of room, and watch it grow! Perfect for herbal teas and adding some flavor to your dishes.

Catnip is fun for your cat, but also makes a wonderful tea for humans, and attracts beneficial pollinators to the garden.
